edu.jhu.cs.oose.biblio.gui
Class FileViewManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.jhu.cs.oose.biblio.gui.FileViewManager

public class FileViewManager
extends java.lang.Object

A class that knows about where different files are displayed. When something wants to display something about a file, either its properties window or the full display of the files, it uses this class to do it.

Field Summary
private  java.util.Map<FileMetadata,FileView> dataToView
          The view associated with all of the files managed by this object.
private  FileViewFactory factory
          The object used to create new windows/displays of files.
private static FileViewManager propManager
          The object in charge of managing the Properties windows.
private static FileViewManager viewManager
          The object in charge of managing the full display of files.
 
Constructor Summary
private FileViewManager()
          Creates a new manager without the ability to creates new views.
 
Method Summary
static FileViewManager getPropertiesManager()
          Returns the object that manages the Properties windows.
static FileViewManager getViewManager()
          Returns the object that manages the full display of files.
 void openFileView(FileMetadata file)
          Opens the view for this file, creating it if necessary.
 void removeView(FileMetadata f)
          Removes the view that was associated with this file.
 void setFactory(FileViewFactory f)
          Gives the Manager a way to create new views for files

          Replaces the view for this file with the given view.

Constructor Detail

FileViewManager

private FileViewManager()
Creates a new manager without the ability to creates new views. You have to set the factory later.

Method Detail

getPropertiesManager

public static FileViewManager getPropertiesManager()
Returns the object that manages the Properties windows.

Returns:
the object that manages the Properties windows.

getViewManager

public static FileViewManager getViewManager()
Returns the object that manages the full display of files.

Returns:
the object that manages the fullk display of files.

openFileView

public void openFileView(FileMetadata file)
Opens the view for this file, creating it if necessary.

Parameters:
file - the file to display info on

setViewFor

public void setViewFor(FileMetadata file,
                       FileView newView)
Replaces the view for this file with the given view. This manager now owns the view.

Parameters:
file - the file to update the view for
newView - the new view of this file

removeView

public void removeView(FileMetadata f)
Removes the view that was associated with this file. It probably got closed, so it shouldn't exist anymore.

Parameters:
f - the file whose view should go away.

setFactory

public void setFactory(FileViewFactory f)
Gives the Manager a way to create new views for files

Parameters:
f - an object that can create views of files
